rtables 0.3.5

Transform rtable to a list of matrices which can be used for outputting

Source: R/tt_toString.R
matrix_form.Rd

Although rtables are represented as a tree data structure when outputting the table to ASCII or HTML it is useful to map the rtable to an in between state with the formatted cells in a matrix form.

matrix_form(tt, indent_rownames = FALSE)

Arguments

tt

TableTree (or related class). A TableTree object representing a populated table.
indent_rownames

logical(1), if TRUE the column with the row names in the strings matrix of has indented row names (strings pre-fixed)

Examples

library(dplyr)

iris2 <- iris %>%
  group_by(Species) %>%
  mutate(group = as.factor(rep_len(c("a", "b"), length.out = n()))) %>%
  ungroup()

l <- basic_table() %>%
  split_cols_by("Species") %>%
  split_cols_by("group") %>%
  analyze(c("Sepal.Length", "Petal.Width"), afun = list_wrap_x(summary) , format = "xx.xx")

l
#> A Pre-data Table Layout
#> 
#> Column-Split Structure:
#> Species (lvls) -> group (lvls) 
#> 
#> Row-Split Structure:
#> ( (** multivar analysis **) -> Sepal.Length, Petal.Width (** multivar analysis **) -> ) (** multivar analysis **) 
#> 

tbl <- build_table(l, iris2)

matrix_form(tbl)
#> $strings
#>       [,1]           [,2]     [,3]     [,4]         [,5]         [,6]       
#>  [1,] ""             "setosa" "setosa" "versicolor" "versicolor" "virginica"
#>  [2,] ""             "a"      "b"      "a"          "b"          "a"
